title.narrative: Livelihd Enhncmnt for the flood affcties

description.narrative:
Livelihood Enhancement for the flood affected communities in Ghotki (Sindh)
Project Description #Livelihood Enhancement for the flood affected communities in Ghotki (Sindh)# This project is aligned with Oxfam Novib#s critical factor of #Linking Rehabilitation toRelief <(>&<)> Development (LRRD) concept. The project builds on the work of the Humanitarian department by working with the same partner within the same area, to continue the process of supporting the flood affected beneficiaries, which were facilitated in 2013 floods. The project aims at building small farmer associations with 50% representation of women, and building the capacities of the target beneficiaries to raise their incomes through enhanced opportunities. The same associations will undertake extensive productivity enhancement activities and it will be aimed to build these as future enterprises.The project will implement in two union councils of District Ghotki, the majority of household#s source of income is agriculture and laborer, working in agriculture field. The project aim to improve the livelihood of rural communities through agriculture through provision of Agri. Farm and Agri. Inputs, to introduce seed bank methodology and capacity building trainings for better management practices, those peoples who are linked with agriculture and there source of income is relate with land and cropping. Women will be supported through provided poultry birds and feed. This activity will contribute in the improvement of livelihood status at household level. Along with this beneficiaries will be supported by providing Fruit, Fodder <(>&<)> Trees plants and it will be sapling at household, school and other communal level for thebenefit and contribute as human life, environmental also fodder for livestock. Capacity building trainings will be organized at community level to enhance their skill in the field of seed bank from pre-sowing up to preservation techniques as well. Beneficiaries will be trained through livestock and poultry rearing trainings whichenable them to keep livestock and poultry safe and take precautionary measure protect from seasonal disease. Fruit, Fodder and trees training will be held for beneficiaries to capacitate them skills and techniques for trees plantation and saplings through practical demonstration at field level.

participating-org.narrative: HANDS Partners in Development played pivoting role in relief, early recovery, rehabilitation and community development work during Pakistan flood 2010. We would like to put on record our appreciation of patrons and friends of HANDS, individual philanthropists, National and International NGOs and Humanitarian organizations for their unflinching, moral, material, financial support and encouragements. Their continuous support made us able to serve more than 13 million populations of 16,703 villages in 24 districts of Pakistan. HANDS is greatly indebted to its Partners who openhandedly contributed for improving the living conditions of the rural community. We do hope that our shared efforts will bring about meaningful change in the living conditions of ruralcommunities. HANDS Livelihood Enhancement Program's on farm component promotes natural resource management, work for food security and income generation of theunderprivileged communities. On farm activities enhance the livelihood of people through agriculture interventions, provision of livestock, poultry and fish farming, transfer of assets, promotion of horticulture and social forestry. The program also provides capacity building trainings to the beneficiaries. Hand objectives is to foster strengthening of organization, knowledge management and ensuring quality of services. HANDS also worked with Oxfam Novib in district Ghotki and Kashmore to support flood affected and vulnerable community in food security perspective through distribution of food package.
